backgroundRationale: One of the main purposes of a monitoring program is to detect changes in a particular variable of interest over time. Serious concerns have been raised about the ability of many fish and stream habitat monitoring programs to detect biologically meaningful changes due to confounding factors such as high natural variability in many ecological variables, poorly designed monitoring programs, inconsistent monitoring protocols, and low statistical power (Larsen et al. 2004, Roni et al. 2008). ISEMP has developed a hierarchical- staircase experimental design for the implementation of the proposed restoration action.
